data.title: Great Middle Georgia Bar-b-que
data.text: A nice location and the looks of a real Bar-b-cue place. They are noted for catering and the in house service is very, very good. Great Bar-b-que and the chicken is great too.  You have great sides to choose from all are good!

data.title: WOW
data.text: If you like homemade French fries and pink lemonade this is the place to be. One of my favorite meals when I'm not in the mood for good BBQ is the hamburger steak and homemade French fries.

data.title: Great barbeque with the fixings
data.text: Great barbeque, and cole slaw. It is a  Great place for work friends, family parties and get together.

data.title: Great Georgia BBQ
data.text: I recommend the "Q"-ban, their take on the Cuban sandwich with bbq. Great sandwich. The boiled peanuts were also good, as we're the fried okra. I'd definitely go back.

data.title: Horrific Fried Chicken
data.text:
Had lunch at Satterfield’s this week. I was looking for their daily special which had fried chicken. Parking was plentiful and open.

I ordered the fried chicken, potato salad, and fried okra with sweet tea. The potato salad and fried okra was fine, but not spectacular by any means. The fried chicken was horrible. It tasted old and like it was fried in oil that was about 6 years old. I could only eat about ½ of it. The best part of the meal was the sweet tea. The fried chicken required me to basically eat Pepcid AC’s and tums for the next 24 hours. It really upset my stomach.

Service was at best fair. First, no one would seat us. Finally we did get a table (the restaurant was empty). One waitress took our order and never came back. Another waitress gave us one tea refill. When we got up to pay we had to stand at the register for 10 minutes to wait to pay.

Overall a very poor experience. I have had their BBQ and it is good, not great. Doubt I will go back.

data.title: Southern home style cooking
data.text: Place has a great old southern style charm with good friendly service. Tried the beef brisket which was ok and got a side of fries which tasted like they hadn't changed the oil in a while. When you order a drink they serve you a cup and a pitcher for refills which I thought was interesting. Lunch for 3 was less than 40 dollars so very reasonable and pretty busy so this must get many locals.

data.title: Really good Barbque
data.text: Very good barbeque and  most of all the smoke turkey is wonderful. If you like barbeque this is the place to come.

data.title: great country food
data.text: great place for lunch,if country cooking is what your looking for try this place, good food very friendly wait staff. we will be back.

data.title: Wedding catered
data.text: We got married in Macon and picked Satterfield's to cater the event.  They done a great job from start to finish. It was a reasonably large wedding (140 guests). The communication from the start of the process to the end was great.The food was great and although I only managed a few bites on the night everybody commented on how good it was. I dont live in Macon but when in town I will be making a visit.

data.title: Good Down Home Cooking
data.text: Good "down home" cooking. A traditional buffet type place - very popular in this area. Not the cheapest place to eat if you go al a cart on everything or add items to the "plate special"....but good food just the same....and really great service staff there as well.

data.title: catered meals
data.text: I have had several catered meals from this place and it was ok but I just have a different taste in food.

data.title: Very Fine Q
data.text: Very good southern styled pork Barbeque, smoked chicken, smoked turkey and all the trimmings.  They are famous for their banana pudding.  I'll tell you a secret.  Everything us top notch.  Their Brunswick Stew is excellent and I am a bit picky about Brunswick Stew.  My wife likes the Pigglets, a BBQ version of the Sliders.  French Fries are great.  Seem to be home styled, fresh cut.  They do a great job with catering.

data.title: Stick to the basics of southern cuisine and ENJOY!
data.text: Only a lunch spot but a nice play to enjoy good old fashioned BBQ, some delicious veggies and some Sweet Tea.  Don't forget to order the boiled peanuts for an appetizer.

data.title: Southern to the bone.
data.text: We were passing through Macon and happened to hear about Satterfield's from a local. So glad we stopped. The menu looks a little hokey, but the food is genuinely good. At our table we had a bar-be-cue plate, a veggie plate, a Drugstore Dog, and a bacon/pimento cheese Willie burger. Each of us insisted we had ordered better than the others. Generous servings. Good service. Will eat there again if we're ever back in Macon.

data.title: Outstanding service with delicious food
data.text: As a southern girl, I know a few things about fried chicken.  Satterfield's knows a few things, too.  Fried chicken, mac & cheese, green beans (called italian green beans?), and tea made me think I was having lunch at one of my favorite relative's house.  Simply done and simply delicious.  Don't debate it, just come on in and receive the warm welcome and yummy vittles.

data.title: Excellent down home atmosphere & food
data.text: Had lunch here when passing through Macon, a wonderful meal of pulled pork BBQ, collard greens, coleslaw, fried okra, Brunswick stew, yuuuuuummmy. Great hostess and dinning room character.

data.title: Great food and great people
data.text: A lot has been said here about the wonderful food, and I definitely want to chime in on that! Everything is absolutely delicious. Something else that sets Satterfield's apart, though, is the warm welcome. Everyone does their best to make sure you enjoy your meal, but you never feel like anyone is hovering around. Everyone is warm, friendly, efficient and committed to a great dining experience. If you find yourself in Macon, don't miss Satterfield's!

data.title: Good change from the chain food.
data.text: Excellent beef tips and rice as the Wednesday daily special. Atmosphere is like a family restaurant with great service. Good home cooking in a relaxed setting.

data.title: Great BBQ, Vegetables, Boiled Peanuts and Sweet Tea!
data.text: I love going to Satterfields for lunch!  Highly recommend the salad plate, with their Smoked Turkey Salad and pimento cheese.  Lots of home cooked vegetables and great squash casserole.  You can even order boiled peanuts as an appetizer and get your own pitcher of sweet tea!

data.title: Good Barbecue at a good price
data.text: I have eaten occasionally at satterfield's for a number of years, but had not been there for a while.  I was recently back in Macon and had a chance to visit again.  Nothing has changed.  The barbecue is quite good and the place is very down-home.  You can get bowls of peanuts (beware-there is a charge), to snack on before your meal comes.  The sides and desserts are good and the people are Southern friendly.
